channel.title: So I made the newspaper
channel.description:
Heh, I recently 'hacked' the school so I got all the passwords from everyone, but some fag stole the list from me and spread it around. I wont go in detail what's my punishment since you don't care, but maybe some dutch people might like to read this :-)
Crappy translation http://www.windowslivetranslator.com/BV.aspx?MKT=nl&lp=nl_en&a=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.tctubantia.nl%2Fvoorpagina%2Farticle1997663.ece Dutch article here: http://www.tctubantia.nl/voorpagina/article1997663.ece
Funny :P

item.title: So I made the newspaper
item.dc:creator: @Gotta_Catch_Them_All Gotta Catch Them All
item.description:
@Gotta_Catch_Them_All wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:29, topic:151130”][quote author=davidude36 link=topic=206753.msg1824186#msg1824186 date=1192487281]
I’m thinking about doing something tothe computer on the last day (I was thinking about making some sort of program to keep duplicating a word file which is 30mb) I randomly made a 25,000 page thing in word and its 30mb so i figured if i kept duplicating it the network hard drive would get full and the school would probably get quite pissed…
[/quote]it takes 0 effort to delete files uno[/quote]

My teachers are like “how i cod moparscap??”.

Read full topic

item.title: So I made the newspaper
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

S!ms:

Yes, but a school can’t force me to pay anything, just as you can’t let me give you 500 euros

Why not? Have you never heard of the term “damages”? You said that charges were being pressed…

item.title: So I made the newspaper
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

S!ms:

Let me remind you it’s a school, and no police office.

So? Unauthorised entry is unauthorised entry, and against the law anywhere, in the UK at least. Not sure about the netherlands, but I’d imagine it’s the same…

Read full topic

item.title: So I made the newspaper
item.dc:creator: @S_ms S!ms
item.description:
@S_ms wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:7, topic:151130”][quote author=S!ms link=topic=206753.msg1817870#msg1817870 date=1192198761]
they can’t force me!
[/quote]

Of course they can’t, it’s only the law after all.[/quote]

Let me remind you it’s a school, and no police office. And the admins over there had to work so hard because their backup software didn’t work… lol. Not my fault

And I was suspended, but I may stay at home because they told me “They didn’t want to hear my name in the next few weeks”

Read full topic

It would have been fairly easy at the school I’m going to…

Too late now though.

item.title: So I made the newspaper
item.dc:creator: @Kamu Kamu
item.description:
@Kamu wrote:

I personally think it sounds like they kept a plain-text password list in a (but most likely hidden) computer share.

Sounds a bit like the time I dumped a list of all the logins at my school, then proceeded to try each one with the default password to get into the school’s online forum thingo (each user had an account with the default password “Password” (lololol). After my app went through the list and gave me a list of who hadn’t changed their password, I gave the list on to a few clown. Hilarity entails.

Read full topic

item.title: So I made the newspaper
item.dc:creator: @Exception Exception
item.description:
@Exception wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:15, topic:151130”]Not trying to burst your bubble or anything, but “your proxy server” is not that special. I doubt you were the one who made it, and if you did it’s still no different than the other big handfull of proxy sites that let you get on at school.

Don’t think you’re evading anyone though, almost every person in each of my classes knows at least three of them, and we all always get on them. Zero of us have been caught throughout our four years of school-blocking-getting-arounding.[/quote]
Thing is, they block all the proxy servers but mine Dynamic IP ftw. And yes, your right, is is just a PHProxy, but I did write the auth system and AdminCP for it.

Read full topic

Not trying to burst your bubble or anything, but “your proxy server” is not that special. I doubt you were the one who made it, and if you did it’s still no different than the other big handfull of proxy sites that let you get on at school.

Don’t think you’re evading anyone though, almost every person in each of my classes knows at least three of them, and we all always get on them. Zero of us have been caught throughout our four years of school-blocking-getting-arounding.

item.title: So I made the newspaper
item.dc:creator: @Hyjall Hyjall
item.description:
@Hyjall wrote:

Yeah I’ll see what I can whip up with my crappy English - Dutch interpretation:

Student cracks computer Waerdenborch

GOOR/HOLTEN - Charges pressed, 2 suspensions and a admin who aged 2 years within a couple of hours.

This is what two 15 year old students of De Waerdenborch accomplished on tuesday.On monday one of them managed to break into the school’s testserver and it was there he found a list of accounts complete with passwords.
His buddy proceeded to mess with this data out of curiosity. This could have lead to all sorts of evil manner were it not that the one of the bystanders collided with his consience and sent a warning mail to the school.

The school immediately proceeded to lock the whole system and repair the leak while the people resposible were being tracked down.

The boys were pressed charges for digital trespassing. Ontop of that they were expelled from school for a couple of days.

Adminstrator Jacques Heijnders: “Fortunately enough, they didn’t mean to damage anything but this shouldn’t have happened.”

That better?

Read full topic
